text: “This is what you shall do to consecrate them to serve as priests to Me: take a young bull and two rams without blemish.
And from the finest wheat flour make unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil.
Place them in a basket and present them in the basket along with the bull and the two rams.
Then bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
Take the garments and dress Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod itself, and the breastpiece, and fasten the ephod on him with its skilfully woven band.
Set the turban on his head and attach the holy emblem to the turban.
Take the anointing oil and apply it on his head to consecrate him.
Bring his sons and clothe them in tunics.
Wrap sashes around Aaron and his sons and fit caps on them. The priesthood shall be theirs by a lasting ordinance. Thus you shall ordain Aaron and his sons.
“Lead the bull to the front of the tent of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall place their hands on its head.
Slaughter the bull before the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
Take some of the bull’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and pour out the rest at the base of the altar.
Take all the fat that covers the entrails, the long lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys with the fat on them, and burn them on the altar.
But burn the bull’s flesh, its hide, and its refuse outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
“Select one of the rams, and Aaron and his sons shall place their hands on its head.
Slaughter the ram and take its blood and sprinkle it around on the altar.
Cut the ram into pieces and wash the entrails and legs, putting them with its head and other pieces.
Then burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord, a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
“Take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall place their hands on its head.

Slaughter the ram, take some of its blood and put it on the lobes of Aaron’s right ear and on the lobes of his sons’ right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. Sprinkle the rest of the blood around on the altar.

Take some of the blood from the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle it on Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and their garments. Thus he and his garments shall be consecrated, as well as his sons and their garments.
“Take from this ram the fat, the fat tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the long lobe of the liver, the two kidneys with the fat on them, and the right thigh. (This is the ram of ordination.)
From the basket of unleavened bread, take one loaf, one cake of bread mixed with oil, and one wafer.
Put all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons and wave them as a wave offering before the Lord.
Then take them from their hands and burn them on the altar on the burnt offering for a soothing aroma before the Lord, an offering by fire to the Lord.
Take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination and wave it as a wave offering before the Lord; it shall be your portion.
Consecrate the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the contribution which was waved and offered from the ram of ordination, from the one for Aaron and from the one for his sons.

It shall be a perpetual share for Aaron and his sons from the Israelites, for it is a contribution; it shall be a contribution from the Israelites from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, their contribution to the Lord.
“Aaron’s holy garments shall belong to his descendants after him, so that they may be anointed and ordained in them.
The son who succeeds him as priest, and comes to the tent of meeting to minister in the Holy Place, shall wear them for seven days.
“Take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a holy place.
At the entrance of the tent of meeting, Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket.
They shall eat those things by which atonement was made at their ordination and consecration, but no outsider shall eat them, because they are holy.
If any of the flesh of ordination or any bread remains until morning, you shall burn the remainder with fire; it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
“Carry out for Aaron and his sons everything I have commanded you, taking seven days to ordain them.
Each day offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement, and purify the altar when you make atonement for it, and anoint it to consecrate it.
For seven days make atonement for the altar and consecrate it; then the altar shall be most holy, and whatever touches the altar shall be holy.
“This is what you shall offer on the altar: two one-year-old lambs each day, regularly.
Offer one lamb in the morning and the other lamb at twilight.
With the first lamb offer a tenth of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil, and a quarter of a hin of wine as a drink offering.
Offer the other lamb at twilight with the same grain offering and the same drink offering as in the morning, for a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
It shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the entrance of the tent of meeting before the Lord, where I will meet with you to speak to you there.
I will meet there with the Israelites, and it shall be consecrated by My glory.
I will sanctify the tent of meeting and the altar; I will also set apart Aaron and his sons to serve as priests to Me.
I will reside among the Israelites and be their God.
They shall know that I am the Lord their God, who brought them out of the land of Egypt so that I might dwell among them. I am the Lord their God.
